name: kiuwan-delivery-analysis-task
description: Run a Kiuwan delivery Kiuwan analysis on the source code extracted by the build configuration.
helpMarkDown: WARNING: Make sure you define the Kiuwan credentials variables in the build definition KiuwanUser and KiuwanPasswd. Otherwise the analysis will fail.
author: Javier Salado

inputs.name: projectnameselector
inputs.label: What do you want to use as Kiuwan application name?
inputs.helpMarkDown: You can use System.TeamProject variable, pick an aexisting application from a list or set a new application name.

inputs.name: kiuwanappname
inputs.label: Available Kiuwan applications
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an existing application in Kiuwan to associate results to.

inputs.name: customappname
inputs.label: Kiuwan application name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Custom application name in Kiuwan to associate results to. It will be cautomatically created if it doesn't exist in your account.

inputs.name: analysislabel
inputs.label: Analysis label
inputs.helpMarkDown: A label to identify this analysis in Kiuwan. The build number is always appended to the specified label. if empty, the label will be the build number.

inputs.name: analysisscope
inputs.label: Anlysis Scope
inputs.helpMarkDown: Status this change reques. Could be in progress or resolved

inputs.name: failonaudit
inputs.label: Fail on Kiuwan audit fail?
inputs.helpMarkDown: Should the task fail if the Kiuwan audit fails?

inputs.name: skipclones
inputs.label: Skip duplication of code analysis?
inputs.helpMarkDown: Skipping the duplicated code analysis is recommended for code security analysis only.

inputs.name: skiparch
inputs.label: Skip architecture analysis?
inputs.helpMarkDown: Skipping the architecture code analysis is recommended for code security analysis only.

inputs.name: crstatus
inputs.label: Change request status
inputs.helpMarkDown: Status of this change request. Could be in progress or resolved

inputs.name: encoding
inputs.label: Source code encoding
inputs.helpMarkDown: Encoding to use to parse the source code files. UTF-8 should work in most cases, but for example if you know that your code has latin characters use ISO-8859-1

inputs.name: includepatterns
inputs.label: Include patterns
inputs.helpMarkDown: Comma separated list of ant like patterns of the files to include in the analysis

inputs.name: excludepatterns
inputs.label: Exclude patterns
inputs.helpMarkDown: Comma separatedlist of ant like patterns to exclude specific files from the analysis

inputs.name: memory
inputs.label: Maximum memory for the analysis (MB)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Maximum memory to allocate to run the analysis in MB. The default value of of 1024, is usually enough for big application you can increase it.

inputs.name: timeout
inputs.label: Analysis timeout (min)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Maximum time to run the analysis. If reached, the analysis will end and fail. Usually the default is enough, change it only in the case of very big applications (more than 1 MLoC).

inputs.name: dbanalysis
inputs.label: Is there database code included in your application?
inputs.helpMarkDown: Check this if you have stored procedures code in your repository to analyze.

inputs.name: dbtechnology
inputs.label: Database technology used in the application
inputs.helpMarkDown: Please, select the type of stored procedures you use in your application. We support Oracle PL/SQL, Microsoft SQLServer TransactSQL, Sybase Transact and Informix stored procedures.
